content: scrappy headband sizes 1 2 3 headband width 8 11 14 cm 3¼ 4¼ 5½ circumference of the headband is adjustable yarn this is a scrap yarn project please see pattern notes for yarn combination recommendations gauge 13 sts x 17rows = 10cm 4 in broken rib stitch on 8 00 mm us 11 needles after blocking suggested needle 8 00 mm us 11 needles or use needle size that obtains gauge notions tapestry needle by skeinny dippin 2023 scrappy headband notes the scrappy headband is worked back and forth in broken rib stitch then seamed at the end to create a twist tips on choosing yarn the scrappy headband is designed to help use up leftover yarns you have from other projects you will need approximately 50-80m for each strand of yarn in your combination i held three strands of fingering weight yarn and two strands of lace mohair together for my sample here are some suggestions of yarn weight combinations 2 x dk + 1 x lace 2 x fingering + 3 x lace 1 x dk + 2 x fingering + 2 x lace 1 x dk + 3 x lace 1 x worsted + 1 x fingering + 2 x lace 2 x worsted 1 x bulky + 1 x fingering 1 x super bulky abbreviations k knit rs right side of work sl1 wyif slip 1 stitch purl-wise with yarn in front st s stitch s p purl ws wrong side of work by skeinny dippin 1 2023 scrappy headband pattern using long tail cast on method cast on 11 15 19 sts row 1 ws sl1 wyif p1 k1 to end of row row 2 rs sl1 wyif k to end of row work row 1 & 2 till the piece measures 50 cm 19 5 or to desired length note for a snug fit the headband should be approximately 4 cm 1½ shorter than your head circumference for a relaxed fit to avoid flattening your hair too much the headband should be your exact head circumference bind off in pattern leaving a 20 cm 8 yarn tail break yarn join the two ends of the headband as follows to create a twist thread yarn tail into the tapestry needle and leave it on the side for now this makes it easier to directly pick up and sew the twist later on fold the headband in half length-wise with the right side facing inwards holding the two folded ends rotate one of the ends 180° so that the openings of the folds are facing each other sandwich the two folds together sew the four layers together across the edge make sure each stitch goes through every layer weave in ends and turn the headband right side out to reveal the twist by skeinny dippin 2 2023 © alexandra
